com.unitedcaterers

Interface UCServer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ClientProxy, RMIUCServerImpl, SocketClientConnector, SocketUCServerImpl, UCServerImpl

    public interface UCServer
extends java.rmi.Remote
    This interface captures all the business methods required by the client. Both - The networked server (RMI as well as Socket based) and non-networked server, implement this interface. The benefit of this approach is that the client can instantiate either a networked server or a non-networked server without having any special code for either of them. Since a server can be either networked or non-networked, all methods throw RemoteException besides throwing a generic UCException, which is an application exception. The implementation of the methods for the non-networked server will only throw UCException, while the implementation of the methods for the networked server will wrap the UCException into RemoteException. The clients should be prepared to handle both the exceptions.
